Related word
apical
finance & economics, law, politics
  specialized in the highest and most powerful position within a structure consisting of similar organizations that are all linked but have different levels of power: The apex court struck down the government's decision. The activities of microfinance institutions must be effectively supervised by the apex bank (= the bank that lends money to other banks, who lend it to organizations, or people). Central banks are apex financial institutions. See also
apex predator
More examplesFewer examplesThe apex bank said that the situation could not be allowed to continue as it was affecting the overall stability of the financial system.The apex regulatory banking institution in the country is the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN).Apex funds are capital funds which are made available by apex institutions to retail-level finance institutions for the purposes of making loans.The National Commission for Informatics was created as the apex government body dealing with IT in the country. The Central Board of Direct Taxes, the apex direct taxes body, withdrew the blanket exemption the scheme had previously been granted.
